The claim is based on a tweet made by U: S. Rep. Patrick Murphy, stating that "91 percent of suspected terrorists who attempted to buy guns in America walked away with the weapon they wanted." This tweet serves as the primary source of the claim.
The claim is supported by a March 2015 r: S. Government Accountability Office (GAO). The report examined the number of people on the FBI's watch list who applied to buy a weapon between February 2004 and December 2014. The report found that out of 2,233 people on the list who applied to buy a weapon, 2,043 were allowed to proceed, which is slightly over 91 percent.
Experts have reviewed the GAO report and: They have stated that the findings are not particularly surprising considering the high number of gun purchases made by Americans during the specified period.
